conclusion: Analyzing shadow changes when light source moves to back left above objects
Shadow A cast by white cloth or paper
Shadow B cast by small table-top mirror
Shadow C cast by thin ring or bracelet
Shadow D cast by avocado or similar fruit
Current light source position is upper right, casting shadows to left/front
New light direction from back left will cast shadows to front right
Shadow A will move to front right and likely become longer
Shadow B will move dramatically to front right with potential complex patterns
Shadow C will move to front right and may become more oval-shaped
Shadow D will move to front right and likely become elongated
All shadows will shift to front right and become elongated
Circular/curved objects may produce more distorted shadows
Shadow B might show complex patterns due to mirror's structure
Repositioning of shadows follows basic principles of light casting
